evidence.pdf_reference: the design and manufacture of Z-scheme photocatalysts for energy conversion and environmental remediation.

above findings confirm the successful preparation of Z-scheme NiTiO 3 g-C 3 N 4 nanocomposite. Photocatalytic performance of as-prepared samples for CO 2 reduction are evaluated at 0.6 MPa and 80 C in the presence of water under visible light irradiation.The photocatalytic experiment with 5 mg, 10 mg and 15 mg of g-C 3 N 4 is performed in 20 mL of distilled water, and the corresponding CH 3 OH yield are 3.13, 4.18 and 3.56 molg -1 h -1 (Fig. S4).Initially, the solution is light yellow, and the increase of

Photocatalytic CO 2 reduction to fuels is recognized as a favorable solution to solve the energy crisis and greenhouse effect simultaneously.Herein, to improve the photoreduction efficiency of CO 2 , a direct Z-scheme NiTiO 3 g-C 3 N 4 (NTGCN) photocatalyst is constructed by a facile calcination method.The highest yield of CH 3 OH (13.74 molg -1 h -1 ) can be obtained at the optimized NTGCN40 without any sacrificial agent and cocatalyst, almost 3.29 times higher compared with g-C 3 N 4 .Simultaneously,

of CO 2 CH 3 OH (-0.38 eV).In contrast, if the photogenerated charge transfer follows Zscheme mechanism, e -on CB of NiTiO 3 will move directly to VB of g-C 3 N 4 and combine with h , leaving e -on CB of g-C 3 N 4 to react with CO to form CH 3 OH, and h on VB of NiTiO 3 to participate in water oxidation reaction.This spatially separated photocatalytic system has efficient charge separation, so as to achieve high photocatalytic performance. To further verify the aforementioned Z-scheme mechanism, the ESR

composites follow the Z-scheme structure mechanism instead of the conventional type-II heterojunction mechanism.If the photogenerated charge transfer follows the conventional type-II heterojunction mechanism, the holes on VB of NiTiO 3 will transfer to VB of g-C 3 N 4 , and the electrons will migrate from CB of g-C 3 N 4 to that of NiTiO 3 .However, NiTiO 3 is not able to reduce CO 2 to CH 3 OH because the E CB of NiTiO (-0.1 eV) is more positive than the reduction potential of CO 2 CH 3 OH (-0.38 eV).In
